requirements.title: Tier-Based Rate Limits
requirements.description: Implement rate limits based on customer tier to manage API usage and prevent abuse.
acceptance_criteria: Free tier: 100 requests per minute, 1,000 requests per day
Pro tier: 1,000 requests per minute, unlimited daily requests
Enterprise tier: Custom limits configured per customer

ambiguity_flags.issue: The term 'fast and scalable' is not quantified.
ambiguity_flags.suggested_action: Define specific performance metrics for scalability and speed.

requirements.title: Rate Limit Response Headers
requirements.description: Include rate limit information in all API responses to inform clients of their usage status.

requirements.title: Rate Limit Exceeded Handling
requirements.description: Define the response behavior when a client exceeds their rate limit.
acceptance_criteria: Return HTTP 429 status code when limit exceeded
Include Retry-After header with seconds until reset
Return JSON error body with clear message and documentation link

requirements.title: Developer Dashboard
requirements.description: Provide a dashboard for developers to view and manage their API usage and limits.
acceptance_criteria: Developers can view current usage and limits
Developers can see historical usage graphs

ambiguity_flags.issue: The term 'user-friendly and intuitive' is not defined.
ambiguity_flags.suggested_action: Specify measurable criteria for user-friendliness and intuitiveness.

requirements.title: Backend Implementation
requirements.description: Implement the technical backend for rate limiting using Redis and support additional features.
acceptance_criteria: Use Redis for storing rate limit counters
Implement bypass mechanism for internal services
Log and alert when customers approach or exceed limits

requirements.title: Monitoring and Observability
requirements.description: Implement monitoring and observability for the rate limiting system.
acceptance_criteria: Emit metrics for rate limit checks, passes, and rejections
Create dashboards showing rate limit health
Alert on anomalies such as sudden spikes in rejections or Redis failures

summary: Implement a tier-based rate limiting system for the public API to prevent abuse, ensure fair usage, and protect backend services.
